intro: Benthamidia sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese benthamidia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
